pokemons.description: It is described in mythology as the pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.

pokemons.name: Victini
pokemons.description: This pokémon brings victory. it is said that trainers with victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

pokemons.name: Snivy
pokemons.description: It is very intelligent and calm. being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

pokemons.name: Servine
pokemons.description: It moves along the ground as if sliding. its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

pokemons.name: Serperior
pokemons.description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. it takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

pokemons.name: Tepig
pokemons.description: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. it roasts berries before it eats them.

pokemons.name: Pignite
pokemons.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. when in trouble, it emits smoke.

pokemons.name: Emboar
pokemons.description: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. it cares deeply about its friends.

pokemons.name: Oshawott
pokemons.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. in response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

pokemons.name: Dewott
pokemons.description: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

pokemons.name: Samurott
pokemons.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. a simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

pokemons.name: Patrat
pokemons.description: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. they use their tails to communicate with others.

pokemons.name: Watchog
pokemons.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

pokemons.name: Lillipup
pokemons.description: It faces strong opponents with great courage. but, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent pokémon flees.

pokemons.name: Herdier
pokemons.description: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

pokemons.name: Stoutland
pokemons.description: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.

pokemons.name: Purrloin
pokemons.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. their deceptively cute act is perfect.

pokemons.name: Liepard
pokemons.description: These pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. many trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.

pokemons.name: Pansage
pokemons.description: This pokémon dwells deep in the forest. eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

pokemons.name: Simisage
pokemons.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. the leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

pokemons.name: Pansear
pokemons.description: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° f. it uses its tuft to roast berries.

pokemons.name: Simisear
pokemons.description: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

pokemons.name: Panpour
pokemons.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. plants that receive its water grow large.

pokemons.name: Simipour
pokemons.description: The tuft on its head holds water. when the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

pokemons.name: Munna
pokemons.description: Munna always float in the air. people whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

pokemons.name: Musharna
pokemons.description: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and pokémon.

pokemons.name: Pidove
pokemons.description: Each follows its trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

pokemons.name: Tranquill
pokemons.description: It can return to its trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.

pokemons.name: Unfezant
pokemons.description: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. the females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.

pokemons.name: Blitzle
pokemons.description: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. it can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

pokemons.name: Zebstrika
pokemons.description: They have lightning-like movements. when zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

pokemons.name: Roggenrola
pokemons.description: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

pokemons.name: Boldore
pokemons.description: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. it looks for underground water in caves.

pokemons.name: Gigalith
pokemons.description: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

pokemons.name: Woobat
pokemons.description: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. it emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

pokemons.name: Swoobat
pokemons.description: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

pokemons.name: Drilbur
pokemons.description: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. it could give a car running aboveground a good race.

pokemons.name: Excadrill
pokemons.description: It can help in tunnel construction. its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

pokemons.name: Audino
pokemons.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

pokemons.name: Timburr
pokemons.description: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. it is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

pokemons.name: Gurdurr
pokemons.description: This pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

pokemons.name: Conkeldurr
pokemons.description: It is thought that conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

pokemons.name: Tympole
pokemons.description: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.

pokemons.name: Palpitoad
pokemons.description: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

pokemons.name: Seismitoad
pokemons.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. they use vibration to hurt their opponents.

pokemons.name: Throh
pokemons.description: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. wild throh use vines to weave their own belts.

pokemons.name: Sawk
pokemons.description: The sound of sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

pokemons.name: Sewaddle
pokemons.description: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. it hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

pokemons.name: Swadloon
pokemons.description: Forests where swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

pokemons.name: Leavanny
pokemons.description: Upon finding a small pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

pokemons.name: Venipede
pokemons.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird pokémon that try to prey on it.

pokemons.name: Whirlipede
pokemons.description: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

pokemons.name: Scolipede
pokemons.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

pokemons.name: Cottonee
pokemons.description: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. the cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

pokemons.name: Whimsicott
pokemons.description: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. it leaves balls of white fluff behind.

pokemons.name: Petilil
pokemons.description: The leaves on its head are very bitter. eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

pokemons.name: Lilligant
pokemons.description: Even veteran trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. this pokémon is popular with celebrities.

pokemons.name: Basculin-red-striped
pokemons.description: Red and blue basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. these pokémon are very hostile.

pokemons.name: Sandile
pokemons.description: They live buried in the sands of the desert. the sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

pokemons.name: Krokorok
pokemons.description: They live in groups of a few individuals. protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

pokemons.name: Krookodile
pokemons.description: They never allow prey to escape. their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

pokemons.name: Darumaka
pokemons.description: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. when the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

pokemons.name: Darmanitan-standard
pokemons.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° f, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

pokemons.name: Maractus
pokemons.description: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

pokemons.name: Dwebble
pokemons.description: This pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.

pokemons.name: Crustle
pokemons.description: Competing for territory, crustle fight viciously. the one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

pokemons.name: Scraggy
pokemons.description: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

pokemons.name: Scrafty
pokemons.description: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

pokemons.name: Sigilyph
pokemons.description: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.

pokemons.name: Yamask
pokemons.description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. sometimes they look at it and cry.

pokemons.name: Cofagrigus
pokemons.description: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. they like to eat gold nuggets.

pokemons.name: Tirtouga
pokemons.description: Restored from a fossil, this pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

pokemons.name: Carracosta
pokemons.description: They can live both in the ocean and on land. a slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.

pokemons.name: Archen
pokemons.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.

pokemons.name: Archeops
pokemons.description: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. from the ground, they use a running start to take flight.

pokemons.name: Trubbish
pokemons.description: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. they prefer unsanitary places.

pokemons.name: Garbodor
pokemons.description: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

pokemons.name: Zorua
pokemons.description: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

pokemons.name: Zoroark
pokemons.description: Bonds between these pokémon are very strong. it protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

pokemons.name: Minccino
pokemons.description: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

pokemons.name: Cinccino
pokemons.description: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

pokemons.name: Gothita
pokemons.description: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. they are always staring at something.

pokemons.name: Gothorita
pokemons.description: They use hypnosis to control people and pokémon. tales of gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

pokemons.name: Gothitelle
pokemons.description: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

pokemons.name: Solosis
pokemons.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. they can use telepathy to talk with others.

pokemons.name: Duosion
pokemons.description: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

pokemons.name: Reuniclus
pokemons.description: When reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

pokemons.name: Ducklett
pokemons.description: These bird pokémon are excellent divers. they swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.

pokemons.name: Swanna
pokemons.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. the one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

pokemons.name: Vanillite
pokemons.description: The temperature of their breath is -58° f. they create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

pokemons.name: Vanillish
pokemons.description: Snowy mountains are this pokémon’s habitat. during an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

pokemons.name: Vanilluxe
pokemons.description: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.

pokemons.name: Deerling
pokemons.description: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. when they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

pokemons.name: Sawsbuck
pokemons.description: They migrate according to the seasons. people can tell the season by looking at sawsbuck’s horns.

pokemons.name: Emolga
pokemons.description: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

pokemons.name: Karrablast
pokemons.description: These mysterious pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as shelmet.

pokemons.name: Escavalier
pokemons.description: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.

pokemons.name: Foongus
pokemons.description: It lures people in with its poké ball pattern, then releases poison spores. why it resembles a poké ball is unknown.

pokemons.name: Amoonguss
pokemons.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble poké balls, in a swaying motion.

pokemons.name: Frillish
pokemons.description: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

pokemons.name: Jellicent
pokemons.description: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

pokemons.name: Alomomola
pokemons.description: The special membrane enveloping alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

pokemons.name: Joltik
pokemons.description: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

pokemons.name: Galvantula
pokemons.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

pokemons.name: Ferroseed
pokemons.description: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

pokemons.name: Ferrothorn
pokemons.description: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. a hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

pokemons.name: Klink
pokemons.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

pokemons.name: Klang
pokemons.description: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. when angry, it rotates faster.

pokemons.name: Klinklang
pokemons.description: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

pokemons.name: Tynamo
pokemons.description: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

pokemons.name: Eelektrik
pokemons.description: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

pokemons.name: Eelektross
pokemons.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. they will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

pokemons.name: Elgyem
pokemons.description: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.

pokemons.name: Beheeyem
pokemons.description: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

pokemons.name: Litwick
pokemons.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

pokemons.name: Lampent
pokemons.description: This ominous pokémon is feared. through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

pokemons.name: Chandelure
pokemons.description: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. by waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.

pokemons.name: Axew
pokemons.description: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

pokemons.name: Fraxure
pokemons.description: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.

pokemons.name: Haxorus
pokemons.description: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. they challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

pokemons.name: Cubchoo
pokemons.description: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its ice-type moves decreases.

pokemons.name: Beartic
pokemons.description: It can make its breath freeze at will. very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

pokemons.name: Cryogonal
pokemons.description: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. when its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.

pokemons.name: Shelmet
pokemons.description: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. it can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.

pokemons.name: Accelgor
pokemons.description: When its body dries out, it weakens. so, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

pokemons.name: Stunfisk
pokemons.description: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. it smiles when transmitting electricity.

pokemons.name: Mienfoo
pokemons.description: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. with their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

pokemons.name: Mienshao
pokemons.description: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

pokemons.name: Druddigon
pokemons.description: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. when its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

pokemons.name: Golett
pokemons.description: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

pokemons.name: Golurk
pokemons.description: It flies across the sky at mach speeds. removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

pokemons.name: Pawniard
pokemons.description: Blades comprise this pokémon’s entire body. if battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

pokemons.name: Bisharp
pokemons.description: It leads a group of pawniard. it battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

pokemons.name: Bouffalant
pokemons.description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

pokemons.name: Rufflet
pokemons.description: They crush berries with their talons. they bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

pokemons.name: Braviary
pokemons.description: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. one can carry a car while flying.

pokemons.name: Vullaby
pokemons.description: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. they guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by mandibuzz.

pokemons.name: Mandibuzz
pokemons.description: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. it grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

pokemons.name: Heatmor
pokemons.description: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. durant is its prey.

pokemons.name: Durant
pokemons.description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from heatmor.

pokemons.name: Deino
pokemons.description: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

pokemons.name: Zweilous
pokemons.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. its two heads do not get along.

pokemons.name: Hydreigon
pokemons.description: This brutal pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.

pokemons.name: Larvesta
pokemons.description: This pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. when it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

pokemons.name: Volcarona
pokemons.description: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.

pokemons.name: Cobalion
pokemons.description: This legendary pokémon battled against humans to protect pokémon. its personality is calm and composed.

pokemons.name: Terrakion
pokemons.description: This pokémon came to the defense of pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.

pokemons.name: Virizion
pokemons.description: This pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. legends about it continue to be passed down.

pokemons.name: Tornadus-incarnate
pokemons.description: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. it zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

pokemons.name: Thundurus-incarnate
pokemons.description: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which thundurus has passed.

pokemons.name: Reshiram
pokemons.description: This pokémon appears in legends. it sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

pokemons.name: Zekrom
pokemons.description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the unova region. it creates electricity in its tail.

pokemons.name: Landorus-incarnate
pokemons.description: Lands visited by landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “the guardian of the fields.”

pokemons.name: Kyurem
pokemons.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

pokemons.name: Keldeo-ordinary
pokemons.description: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. it excels at using leg moves while battling.

pokemons.name: Meloetta-aria
pokemons.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

pokemons.name: Genesect
pokemons.description: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. it has been modified by team plasma.

pokemons.name: Chespin
pokemons.description: The quills on its head are usually soft. when it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

pokemons.name: Quilladin
pokemons.description: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. it counterattacks with its sharp quills.

pokemons.name: Chesnaught
pokemons.description: Its tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. it shields its allies from danger with its own body.

pokemons.name: Fennekin
pokemons.description: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: Braixen
pokemons.description: It has a twig stuck in its tail. with friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

pokemons.name: Delphox
pokemons.description: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

pokemons.name: Froakie
pokemons.description: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. the bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

pokemons.name: Frogadier
pokemons.description: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

pokemons.name: Greninja
pokemons.description: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. when it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

pokemons.name: Bunnelby
pokemons.description: They use their large ears to dig burrows. they will dig the whole night through.

pokemons.name: Diggersby
pokemons.description: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. they can be a big help at construction sites.

pokemons.name: Fletchling
pokemons.description: These friendly pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

pokemons.name: Fletchinder
pokemons.description: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

pokemons.name: Talonflame
pokemons.description: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

pokemons.name: Scatterbug
pokemons.description: When under attack from bird pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

pokemons.name: Spewpa
pokemons.description: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. when predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

pokemons.name: Vivillon
pokemons.description: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. these patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

pokemons.name: Litleo
pokemons.description: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

pokemons.name: Pyroar
pokemons.description: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

pokemons.name: Flabebe
pokemons.description: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. the flower flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

pokemons.name: Floette
pokemons.description: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. it draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

pokemons.name: Florges
pokemons.description: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

pokemons.name: Skiddo
pokemons.description: Thought to be one of the first pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

pokemons.name: Gogoat
pokemons.description: It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. this empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

pokemons.name: Pancham
pokemons.description: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

pokemons.name: Pangoro
pokemons.description: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. it uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

pokemons.name: Furfrou
pokemons.description: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

pokemons.name: Espurr
pokemons.description: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

pokemons.name: Meowstic-male
pokemons.description: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

pokemons.name: Honedge
pokemons.description: Apparently this pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. it attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

pokemons.name: Doublade
pokemons.description: When honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

pokemons.name: Aegislash-shield
pokemons.description: Generations of kings were attended by these pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and pokémon.

pokemons.name: Spritzee
pokemons.description: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. this fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

pokemons.name: Aromatisse
pokemons.description: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

pokemons.name: Swirlix
pokemons.description: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

pokemons.name: Slurpuff
pokemons.description: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. it puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

pokemons.name: Inkay
pokemons.description: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

pokemons.name: Malamar
pokemons.description: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

pokemons.name: Binacle
pokemons.description: Two binacle live together on one rock. when they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

pokemons.name: Barbaracle
pokemons.description: When they evolve, two binacle multiply into seven. they fight with the power of seven binacle.

pokemons.name: Skrelp
pokemons.description: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

pokemons.name: Dragalge
pokemons.description: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

pokemons.name: Clauncher
pokemons.description: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

pokemons.name: Clawitzer
pokemons.description: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

pokemons.name: Helioptile
pokemons.description: They make their home in deserts. they can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

pokemons.name: Heliolisk
pokemons.description: They flare their frills and generate energy. a single heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

pokemons.name: Tyrunt
pokemons.description: This pokémon was restored from a fossil. if something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

pokemons.name: Tyrantrum
pokemons.description: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.

pokemons.name: Amaura
pokemons.description: This ancient pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

pokemons.name: Aurorus
pokemons.description: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

pokemons.name: Sylveon
pokemons.description: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.

pokemons.name: Hawlucha
pokemons.description: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like machamp and hariyama.

pokemons.name: Dedenne
pokemons.description: Its whiskers serve as antennas. by sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

pokemons.name: Carbink
pokemons.description: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

pokemons.name: Goomy
pokemons.description: The weakest dragon-type pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.

pokemons.name: Sliggoo
pokemons.description: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.

pokemons.name: Goodra
pokemons.description: This very friendly dragon-type pokémon will hug its beloved trainer, leaving that trainer covered in sticky slime.

pokemons.name: Klefki
pokemons.description: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

pokemons.name: Phantump
pokemons.description: These pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. they prefer to live in abandoned forests.

pokemons.name: Trevenant
pokemons.description: It can control trees at will. it will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

pokemons.name: Pumpkaboo-average
pokemons.description: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. as the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

pokemons.name: Gourgeist-average
pokemons.description: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. anyone who hears their song is cursed.

pokemons.name: Bergmite
pokemons.description: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. it uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

pokemons.name: Avalugg
pokemons.description: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

pokemons.name: Noibat
pokemons.description: They live in pitch-black caves. their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

pokemons.name: Noivern
pokemons.description: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.

pokemons.name: Xerneas
pokemons.description: Legends say it can share eternal life. it slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

pokemons.name: Yveltal
pokemons.description: When this legendary pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

pokemons.name: Zygarde-50
pokemons.description: When the kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.

pokemons.name: Diancie
pokemons.description: A sudden transformation of carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

pokemons.name: Hoopa
pokemons.description: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

pokemons.name: Volcanion
pokemons.description: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. it’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

pokemons.name: Rowlet
pokemons.description: This wary pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

pokemons.name: Dartrix
pokemons.description: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

pokemons.name: Decidueye
pokemons.description: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.

pokemons.name: Litten
pokemons.description: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. it sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

pokemons.name: Torracat
pokemons.description: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. the bell rings brightly whenever this pokémon spits fire.

pokemons.name: Incineroar
pokemons.description: This pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. if it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.

pokemons.name: Popplio
pokemons.description: This pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. it’s famous for being a hard worker.

pokemons.name: Brionne
pokemons.description: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.

pokemons.name: Primarina
pokemons.description: It controls its water balloons with song. the melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

pokemons.name: Pikipek
pokemons.description: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. it uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.

pokemons.name: Trumbeak
pokemons.description: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. when it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.

pokemons.name: Toucannon
pokemons.description: When it battles, its beak heats up. the temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.

pokemons.name: Yungoos
pokemons.description: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. it did not originally live in alola but was imported from another region.

pokemons.name: Gumshoos
pokemons.description: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.

pokemons.name: Grubbin
pokemons.description: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. it normally lives underground.

pokemons.name: Charjabug
pokemons.description: Its body is capable of storing electricity. on camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.

pokemons.name: Vikavolt
pokemons.description: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. it concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.

pokemons.name: Crabrawler
pokemons.description: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. when it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.

pokemons.name: Crabominable
pokemons.description: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. being forced to endure the cold, this pokémon evolved and grew fur.

pokemons.name: Oricorio-baile
pokemons.description: It beats its wings together to create fire. as it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.

pokemons.name: Cutiefly
pokemons.description: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

pokemons.name: Ribombee
pokemons.description: It rolls up pollen into puffs. it makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

pokemons.name: Rockruff
pokemons.description: It’s considered to be a good pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.

pokemons.name: Lycanroc-midday
pokemons.description: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.

pokemons.name: Wishiwashi-solo
pokemons.description: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. the shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

pokemons.name: Mareanie
pokemons.description: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. when the prey has weakened, mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

pokemons.name: Toxapex
pokemons.description: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. it leaves a trail of corsola bits scattered in its wake.

pokemons.name: Mudbray
pokemons.description: The mud stuck to mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.

pokemons.name: Mudsdale
pokemons.description: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

pokemons.name: Dewpider
pokemons.description: It crawls onto the land in search of food. its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

pokemons.name: Araquanid
pokemons.description: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. small pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

pokemons.name: Fomantis
pokemons.description: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. when night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.

pokemons.name: Lurantis
pokemons.description: It requires a lot of effort to maintain lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.

pokemons.name: Morelull
pokemons.description: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

pokemons.name: Shiinotic
pokemons.description: Forests where shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. people confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

pokemons.name: Salandit
pokemons.description: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. when its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

pokemons.name: Salazzle
pokemons.description: For some reason, only females have been found. it creates a reverse harem of male salandit that it lives with.

pokemons.name: Stufful
pokemons.description: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

pokemons.name: Bewear
pokemons.description: This immensely dangerous pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. its habitat is generally off-limits.

pokemons.name: Bounsweet
pokemons.description: A delectable aroma pours from its body. they are often swallowed whole by toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.

pokemons.name: Steenee
pokemons.description: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. these are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird pokémon, this pokémon is totally fine.

pokemons.name: Tsareena
pokemons.description: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. in victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.

pokemons.name: Comfey
pokemons.description: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. this revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.

pokemons.name: Oranguru
pokemons.description: Known for its extreme intelligence, this pokémon will look down on inexperienced trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran trainers.

pokemons.name: Passimian
pokemons.description: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

pokemons.name: Wimpod
pokemons.description: This pokémon is a coward. as it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

pokemons.name: Golisopod
pokemons.description: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.

pokemons.name: Sandygast
pokemons.description: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.

pokemons.name: Palossand
pokemons.description: Possessed people controlled by this pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. as it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.

pokemons.name: Pyukumuku
pokemons.description: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

pokemons.name: Type-null
pokemons.description: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. this pokémon has some hidden special power.

pokemons.name: Silvally
pokemons.description: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. this pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.

pokemons.name: Minior-red-meteor
pokemons.description: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.

pokemons.name: Komala
pokemons.description: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. all its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.

pokemons.name: Turtonator
pokemons.description: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. the hole in its stomach is its weak point.

pokemons.name: Togedemaru
pokemons.description: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. when this pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

pokemons.name: Mimikyu-disguised
pokemons.description: Its actual appearance is unknown. a scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.

pokemons.name: Bruxish
pokemons.description: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.

pokemons.name: Drampa
pokemons.description: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.

pokemons.name: Dhelmise
pokemons.description: Swinging its massive anchor, it can ko wailord in a single blow. what appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.

pokemons.name: Jangmo-o
pokemons.description: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where jangmo-o lives.

pokemons.name: Hakamo-o
pokemons.description: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.

pokemons.name: Kommo-o
pokemons.description: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.

pokemons.name: Tapu-koko
pokemons.description: This guardian deity of melemele is brimming with curiosity. it summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.

pokemons.name: Tapu-lele
pokemons.description: This guardian deity of akala is guilelessly cruel. the fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

pokemons.name: Tapu-bulu
pokemons.description: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. it causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.

pokemons.name: Tapu-fini
pokemons.description: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. ocean currents are the source of its energy.

pokemons.name: Cosmog
pokemons.description: Its body is gaseous and frail. it slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

pokemons.name: Cosmoem
pokemons.description: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. in the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.

pokemons.name: Solgaleo
pokemons.description: It is said to live in another world. the intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.

pokemons.name: Lunala
pokemons.description: It is said to be a female evolution of cosmog. when its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.

pokemons.name: Nihilego
pokemons.description: One of several mysterious ultra beasts. people on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.

pokemons.name: Buzzwole
pokemons.description: This ultra beast appeared from another world. it shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.

pokemons.name: Pheromosa
pokemons.description: One of the dangerous ultra beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.

pokemons.name: Xurkitree
pokemons.description: One of the mysterious life-forms known as ultra beasts. astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.

pokemons.name: Celesteela
pokemons.description: It appeared from the ultra wormhole. witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.

pokemons.name: Kartana
pokemons.description: This ultra beast came from the ultra wormhole. it seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.

pokemons.name: Guzzlord
pokemons.description: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. it’s one of the ultra beasts.

pokemons.name: Necrozma
pokemons.description: Reminiscent of the ultra beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.

pokemons.name: Magearna
pokemons.description: This artificial pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.

pokemons.name: Marshadow
pokemons.description: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.

pokemons.name: Poipole
pokemons.description: This ultra beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

pokemons.name: Naganadel
pokemons.description: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. it is one of the organisms known as ubs.

pokemons.name: Stakataka
pokemons.description: It appeared from an ultra wormhole. each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

pokemons.name: Blacephalon
pokemons.description: It slithers toward people. then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. it’s apparently one kind of ultra beast.

pokemons.name: Zeraora
pokemons.description: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

pokemons.name: Meltan
pokemons.description: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

pokemons.name: Melmetal
pokemons.description: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.

pokemons.name: Grookey
pokemons.description: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

pokemons.name: Thwackey
pokemons.description: The faster a thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

pokemons.name: Rillaboom
pokemons.description: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. the roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

pokemons.name: Scorbunny
pokemons.description: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this pokémon’s body. once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.

pokemons.name: Raboot
pokemons.description: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

pokemons.name: Cinderace
pokemons.description: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

pokemons.name: Sobble
pokemons.description: When scared, this pokémon cries. its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.

pokemons.name: Drizzile
pokemons.description: A clever combatant, this pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

pokemons.name: Inteleon
pokemons.description: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

pokemons.name: Skwovet
pokemons.description: Found throughout the galar region, this pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

pokemons.name: Greedent
pokemons.description: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. but this pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.

pokemons.name: Rookidee
pokemons.description: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. this pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

pokemons.name: Corvisquire
pokemons.description: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

pokemons.name: Corviknight
pokemons.description: This pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the galar region. the black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

pokemons.name: Blipbug
pokemons.description: A constant collector of information, this pokémon is very smart. very strong is what it isn’t.

pokemons.name: Dottler
pokemons.description: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.

pokemons.name: Orbeetle
pokemons.description: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.

pokemons.name: Nickit
pokemons.description: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other pokémon. it survives off its ill-gotten gains.

pokemons.name: Thievul
pokemons.description: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. by following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

pokemons.name: Gossifleur
pokemons.description: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. after absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

pokemons.name: Eldegoss
pokemons.description: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. it spreads them on the wind so that plants and other pokémon can benefit from them.

pokemons.name: Wooloo
pokemons.description: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

pokemons.name: Dubwool
pokemons.description: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. you’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

pokemons.name: Chewtle
pokemons.description: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.

pokemons.name: Drednaw
pokemons.description: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

pokemons.name: Yamper
pokemons.description: This pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the galar region. as it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

pokemons.name: Boltund
pokemons.description: This pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

pokemons.name: Rolycoly
pokemons.description: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. fittingly, this pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

pokemons.name: Carkol
pokemons.description: It forms coal inside its body. coal dropped by this pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the galar region.

pokemons.name: Coalossal
pokemons.description: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: Applin
pokemons.description: It spends its entire life inside an apple. it hides from its natural enemies, bird pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.

pokemons.name: Flapple
pokemons.description: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. in its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

pokemons.name: Appletun
pokemons.description: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. a nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug pokémon it preys on.

pokemons.name: Silicobra
pokemons.description: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. the pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.

pokemons.name: Sandaconda
pokemons.description: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. if it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.

pokemons.name: Cramorant
pokemons.description: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

pokemons.name: Arrokuda
pokemons.description: If it sees any movement around it, this pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. it’s very proud of that jaw.

pokemons.name: Barraskewda
pokemons.description: This pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. apparently barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

pokemons.name: Toxel
pokemons.description: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. if you touch this pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

pokemons.name: Toxtricity-amped
pokemons.description: When this pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a guitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.

pokemons.name: Sizzlipede
pokemons.description: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. the yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

pokemons.name: Centiskorch
pokemons.description: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees fahrenheit. it lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

pokemons.name: Clobbopus
pokemons.description: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. the search for food is what brings it onto land.

pokemons.name: Grapploct
pokemons.description: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

pokemons.name: Sinistea
pokemons.description: This pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

pokemons.name: Polteageist
pokemons.description: This species lives in antique teapots. most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

pokemons.name: Hatenna
pokemons.description: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. if you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

pokemons.name: Hattrem
pokemons.description: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this pokémon, it will silence you violently.

pokemons.name: Hatterene
pokemons.description: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

pokemons.name: Impidimp
pokemons.description: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and pokémon when they feel annoyed. it thrives off this negative energy.

pokemons.name: Morgrem
pokemons.description: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

pokemons.name: Grimmsnarl
pokemons.description: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this pokémon can overwhelm even machamp.

pokemons.name: Obstagoon
pokemons.description: Its voice is staggering in volume. obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as obstruct.

pokemons.name: Perrserker
pokemons.description: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. this pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

pokemons.name: Cursola
pokemons.description: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. the ectoplasm serves as protection for this pokémon’s core spirit.

pokemons.name: Sirfetchd
pokemons.description: Only farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. when this pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

pokemons.name: Mr-rime
pokemons.description: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. it waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

pokemons.name: Runerigus
pokemons.description: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. after absorbing the spirit of a yamask, the painting began to move.

pokemons.name: Milcery
pokemons.description: This pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. its body is made of cream.

pokemons.name: Alcremie
pokemons.description: When it trusts a trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.

pokemons.name: Falinks
pokemons.description: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. the brass’s orders are absolute.

pokemons.name: Pincurchin
pokemons.description: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

pokemons.name: Snom
pokemons.description: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

pokemons.name: Frosmoth
pokemons.description: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. the temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: Stonjourner
pokemons.description: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. this pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

pokemons.name: Eiscue-ice
pokemons.description: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. it keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

pokemons.name: Indeedee-male
pokemons.description: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.

pokemons.name: Morpeko-full-belly
pokemons.description: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. it’s also generating electricity.

pokemons.name: Cufant
pokemons.description: It digs up the ground with its trunk. it’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

pokemons.name: Copperajah
pokemons.description: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. their green skin is resistant to water.

pokemons.name: Dracozolt
pokemons.description: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

pokemons.name: Arctozolt
pokemons.description: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. it has a hard time walking around.

pokemons.name: Dracovish
pokemons.description: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

pokemons.name: Arctovish
pokemons.description: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

pokemons.name: Duraludon
pokemons.description: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. the only drawback is that it rusts easily.

pokemons.name: Dreepy
pokemons.description: After being reborn as a ghost pokémon, dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

pokemons.name: Drakloak
pokemons.description: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. it battles alongside dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

pokemons.name: Dragapult
pokemons.description: When it isn’t battling, it keeps dreepy in the holes on its horns. once a fight starts, it launches the dreepy like supersonic missiles.

pokemons.name: Zacian
pokemons.description: Known as a legendary hero, this pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.

pokemons.name: Zamazenta
pokemons.description: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the galar region. it absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

pokemons.name: Eternatus
pokemons.description: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the galar region. this energy is what allows eternatus to stay active.

pokemons.name: Kubfu
pokemons.description: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. the moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

pokemons.name: Urshifu-single-strike
pokemons.description: This form of urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit ko. its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.

pokemons.name: Zarude
pokemons.description: Within dense forests, this pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. it’s incredibly aggressive, and the other pokémon of the forest fear it.

pokemons.name: Regieleki
pokemons.description: This pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. it’s said that removing the rings on regieleki’s body will unleash the pokémon’s latent power.

pokemons.name: Regidrago
pokemons.description: An academic theory proposes that regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon pokémon. the theory remains unproven.

pokemons.name: Glastrier
pokemons.description: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. it’s also a belligerent pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.

pokemons.name: Spectrier
pokemons.description: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.

pokemons.name: Calyrex
pokemons.description: Calyrex is a merciful pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. it reigned over the galar region in times of yore.

pokemons.name: Wyrdeer
pokemons.description: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. the fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

pokemons.name: Kleavor
pokemons.description: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. if one should chance upon this pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

pokemons.name: Ursaluna
pokemons.description: I believe it was hisui's swampy terrain that gave ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

pokemons.name: Basculegion-male
pokemons.description: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. no other species throughout all hisui's rivers is basculegion's equal.

pokemons.name: Sneasler
pokemons.description: Because of sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

pokemons.name: Overqwil
pokemons.description: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname ”sea fiend.” it slurps up poison to nourish itself.

pokemons.name: Enamorus-incarnate
pokemons.description: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. according to legend, this pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across hisui.

pokemons.name: Sprigatito
pokemons.description: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. this pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

pokemons.name: Floragato
pokemons.description: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

pokemons.name: Meowscarada
pokemons.description: This pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

pokemons.name: Fuecoco
pokemons.description: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

pokemons.name: Crocalor
pokemons.description: The combination of crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the pokémon’s head.

pokemons.name: Skeledirge
pokemons.description: The fiery bird changes shape when skeledirge sings. rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on skeledirge’s head gained a soul.

pokemons.name: Quaxly
pokemons.description: This pokémon migrated to paldea from distant lands long ago. the gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime."

pokemons.name: Quaxwell
pokemons.description: These pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

pokemons.name: Quaquaval
pokemons.description: A single kick from a quaquaval can send a truck rolling. this pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.

pokemons.name: Lechonk
pokemons.description: It searches for food all day. it possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.

pokemons.name: Oinkologne
pokemons.description: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. it emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.

pokemons.name: Tarountula
pokemons.description: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of scyther, this pokémon’s natural enemy.

pokemons.name: Spidops
pokemons.description: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. it takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.

pokemons.name: Nymble
pokemons.description: It has its third set of legs folded up. when it’s in a tough spot, this pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

pokemons.name: Lokix
pokemons.description: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter showdown mode. it neutralizes its enemies in short order.

pokemons.name: Pawmi
pokemons.description: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. these sacs can produce electricity only if pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

pokemons.name: Pawmo
pokemons.description: When its group is attacked, pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.

pokemons.name: Pawmot
pokemons.description: This pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

pokemons.name: Tandemaus
pokemons.description: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

pokemons.name: Maushold
pokemons.description: The two little ones just appeared one day. the group might be a family of related pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.

pokemons.name: Fidough
pokemons.description: This pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. yeast in fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the pokémon’s vicinity.

pokemons.name: Dachsbun
pokemons.description: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.

pokemons.name: Smoliv
pokemons.description: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. this oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

pokemons.name: Dolliv
pokemons.description: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. this species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

pokemons.name: Arboliva
pokemons.description: This calm pokémon is very compassionate. it will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened pokémon.

pokemons.name: Squawkabilly
pokemons.description: These pokémon prefer to live in cities. they form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.

pokemons.name: Nacli
pokemons.description: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. this species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

pokemons.name: Naclstack
pokemons.description: This pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. the curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.

pokemons.name: Garganacl
pokemons.description: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured pokémon with salt. even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

pokemons.name: Charcadet
pokemons.description: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a pokémon. possessing a fiery fighting spirit, charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

pokemons.name: Armarouge
pokemons.description: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. this pokémon is incredibly loyal.

pokemons.name: Ceruledge
pokemons.description: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

pokemons.name: Tadbulb
pokemons.description: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. if it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

pokemons.name: Bellibolt
pokemons.description: When this pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

pokemons.name: Wattrel
pokemons.description: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. this pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

pokemons.name: Kilowattrel
pokemons.description: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. by riding the wind, this pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

pokemons.name: Maschiff
pokemons.description: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see maschiff’s face.

pokemons.name: Mabosstiff
pokemons.description: This pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.

pokemons.name: Shroodle
pokemons.description: Though usually a mellow pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

pokemons.name: Grafaiai
pokemons.description: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the pokémon eats. grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

pokemons.name: Bramblin
pokemons.description: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a pokémon.

pokemons.name: Brambleghast
pokemons.description: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.

pokemons.name: Toedscool
pokemons.description: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. the flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.

pokemons.name: Toedscruel
pokemons.description: These pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. they absolutely hate it when strangers approach.

pokemons.name: Klawf
pokemons.description: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. but klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.

pokemons.name: Capsakid
pokemons.description: The more sunlight this pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

pokemons.name: Scovillain
pokemons.description: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.

pokemons.name: Rellor
pokemons.description: This pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. it treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

pokemons.name: Rabsca
pokemons.description: The body that supports the ball barely moves. therefore, it is thought that the true body of this pokémon is actually inside the ball.

pokemons.name: Flittle
pokemons.description: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the pokémon’s belly.

pokemons.name: Espathra
pokemons.description: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.

pokemons.name: Tinkatink
pokemons.description: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by pokémon that eat metal.

pokemons.name: Tinkatuff
pokemons.description: This pokémon will attack groups of pawniard and bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

pokemons.name: Tinkaton
pokemons.description: This intelligent pokémon has a very daring disposition. it knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying corviknight.

pokemons.name: Wiglett
pokemons.description: This pokémon can pick up the scent of a veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

pokemons.name: Wugtrio
pokemons.description: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. it wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

pokemons.name: Bombirdier
pokemons.description: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.

pokemons.name: Finizen
pokemons.description: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. it uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

pokemons.name: Palafin
pokemons.description: This pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.

pokemons.name: Varoom
pokemons.description: It is said that this pokémon was born when an unknown poison pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

pokemons.name: Revavroom
pokemons.description: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. it then detonates the gas in its cylinders—now numbering eight—to generate energy.

pokemons.name: Cyclizar
pokemons.description: Apparently cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

pokemons.name: Orthworm
pokemons.description: When attacked, this pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.

pokemons.name: Glimmet
pokemons.description: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. the petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

pokemons.name: Glimmora
pokemons.description: When this pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.

pokemons.name: Greavard
pokemons.description: It is said that a dog pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this pokémon.

pokemons.name: Houndstone
pokemons.description: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. among all the dog pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.

pokemons.name: Flamigo
pokemons.description: This pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

pokemons.name: Cetoddle
pokemons.description: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. it seems to be closely related to wailmer.

pokemons.name: Cetitan
